description: '''Subb''' was a Canadian [[ska punk]] band formed in November 1992 in [[Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu]], a suburb outside of [[Montreal|Montreal, Quebec]]. Since their beginning in the early 1990s, the band released four full-length albums, one EP and one split CD on the labels [[Stomp Records]] and Underworld Records. Though they experienced several lineup changes over the years, founding members Mart Charron and Stef Gauthier remained in the group. The band's musical style initially blended elements of [[punk rock]], [[ska]], and [[hardcore punk|hardcore]] into a genre popularly known as [[ska punk]] or "ska-core," which characterized their first two albums. In 2002, they were moving away from this sound and producing an album with a heavy pop punk influence. After a brief hiatus in 2003, the band moved back towards their ska, punk and hardcore elements.
